base: Egypt (multiple landing grounds including LG-174, Burg El Arab)

operations_history.operation: Battle of El Alamein - Axis Retreat

sources: Air Force Combat Units of World War II (USAF Official History)
Asisbiz.com - 57th Fighter Group P-40 variant documentation
American Air Museum - 57th Fighter Group operational records
metadata.notes: Initial deployment with 72 P-40F aircraft confirmed in June 1942. Unit began combat operations October 1942 after RAF training. Specific aircraft variant sub-models (P-40F-1, F-10, F-15, P-40K-1) documented from Asisbiz.com Tier 2 source. Personnel and exact Q4 1942 strength numbers estimated based on USAAF fighter group standard organization (3 squadrons, ~25 aircraft each). Commander Frank H. Mears confirmed until December 20, 1942 when Col Arthur G Salisbury took command. Squadron structure: 64th FS (Black Scorpions), 65th FS, 66th FS. P-40K variant introduced late 1942 as P-40F supplies dwindled. Operations data compiled from multiple sources with emphasis on Battle of El Alamein participation and Western Desert Campaign support.
metadata.witw_validation: WITW _airgroup.csv search conducted - 57th Fighter Group not found in available WITW database file
